property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.IP_ADDRESS
property.description: The address that Sip Communicator should advertise for media sessions. (If unsure leave that blank)

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.AUDIO_PORT
property.description: Specifies the port that SipCommunicator should use to receive audio. Default is 22224

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.VIDEO_PORT
property.description: Specifies the port that SipCommunicator should use to receive video. Default is 22222

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.MEDIA_SOURCE
property.description: This property is very useful if you do not have a camera or no capture devices at all but would like to transmit audio and/or video. You can enter the URL of a media file (e.g. file://home/user/sipcommunicator/lostinspace.mov) and it will be used to send audio and/or video streams to the remote party. Default is null (this means use capture devices).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.PREFERRED_AUDIO_ENCODING
property.description: The sdp code of the audio encoding format that Sip Communicator should use in media advertisements. (example values are 0 - PCMU, 3 - GSM, 8 - PCMA, 9 - G722, see rfc1890 page 15 for further details).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.media.PREFERRED_VIDEO_ENCODING
property.description: The sdp code of the video encoding format that Sip Communicator should use in media advertisements. (example values are 26 - JPEG, 34 - H.261, see rfc1890 page 15 for further details).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.STACK_PATH
property.description: The fully qualified path to the package that contains the JAIN-SIP implementation. If you want to use the phone with another stack, that is where you should plug it. Default is gov.nist

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.PUBLIC_ADDRESS
property.description: Your SIP address. ( example: sip:alice@atlanta.com )

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.DISPLAY_NAME
property.description: Your name (example: Alice Doe).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.TRANSPORT
property.description: The protocol that Sip Communicator should use to transfer SIP messages (tcp or udp, default is udp).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.PREFERRED_LOCAL_PORT
property.description: The port where Sip Communicator should listen for incoming SIP messages. If it fails to bind to that port Sip Communicator will randomly bind to another one.

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.REGISTRAR_ADDRESS
property.description: The address of your registrar server (if any).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.REGISTRAR_PORT
property.description: The port where the registrar server is listening.

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.REGISTRAR_TRANSPORT
property.description: The transport protocol that should be used when contacting the registrar server.

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.REGISTRATIONS_EXPIRATION
property.description: The time that registrations with the registrar server will remain valid. Sip Communicator automatically renews registration after the time has expired (default is 3600).

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_REALM
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.WAIT_UNREGISTGRATION_FOR
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sip.SAME_USER_EVERYWHERE
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sipphone.IS_RUNNING_SIPPHONE
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sipphone.MY_SIPPHONE_URL
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.gui.AUTH_WIN_TITLE
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.gui.AUTHENTICATION_PROMPT
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.gui.USER_NAME_LABEL
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.sipphone.USER_NAME_EXAMPLE
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.gui.PASSWORD_LABEL
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.STUN_SERVER_ADDRESS
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.STUN_SERVER_PORT
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: net.java.sip.communicator.VOICE_MAIL_ADDRESS
property.description: Describe it!

property.name: javax.sip.IP_ADDRESS
property.description: Sets the IP Address of the SipStack to the property value i.e 11.1.111.111. Default is InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostAddress().

property.name: javax.sip.STACK_NAME
property.description: A name that should be given to the stack thread (used for debugging).

property.name: javax.sip.ROUTER_PATH
property.description: The class that will route outgoing sip messages (default is net.java.sip.communicator.sip.SipCommRouter)

property.name: javax.sip.RETRANSMISSON_FILTER
property.description: Specifies whether the stack should filter retransmitted messages or pass them to the application. Leave that blank unless you are sure what you are doing.

property.name: javax.sip.OUTBOUND_PROXY
property.description: Fill this in if you are using a SIP proxy server. IMPORTANT! Format is <font color="blue">&#60address>:&#60port>/&#60transport></font>. Where <font color="blue">&#60address></font> is the IP address or FQDN of the proxy server. <font color="blue">&#60port></font> is its port and <font color="blue">&#60transport></font> is the protocol that it uses, tcp or udp.

property.name: javax.sip.EXTENSION_METHODS
property.description: Non standard methods that should be considere as a Start of a dialog.

property.name: gov.nist.javax.sip.TRACE_LEVEL
property.description: Trace level indicates the stack the level of logging. 32 logs everything and 1 for weakest logging.

property.name: gov.nist.javax.sip.SERVER_LOG
property.description: The name of the file where the stack should store its log messages.

property.name: log4j.rootLogger
property.description: Needed by Log4J

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger
property.description: Needed by Log4J

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.File
property.description: Log file name.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.MaxFileSize
property.description: The maximum allowable size of the log file.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.MaxBackupIndex
property.description: Number of log files to keep in backup.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.layout
property.description: The layout to used when logging messages.

property.name: log4j.appender.RFLogger.layout.ConversionPattern
property.description: Conversion pattern. Needed by Log4J
